DOC.HEAD: Southwest Plans Fare Cuts
DOC.TEXT: Southwest Airlines will reduce many of its long distance air fares through mid-March, the company announced. Southwest on Tuesday also placed a $99 ceiling on any one-way fare purchased 21 days ahead of travel Mondays thru Thursdays and Saturdays. In announcing the fares, Southwest marketing vice president Donald G. Valentine pronounced the Dallas-based carrier the ``price policeman'' of the airline industry. Under the reduction, customers must buy tickets by Jan. 20 and travel between Jan. 6 and March 15. Customers using the rates may not fly on Friday or Sunday, but there is not a Saturday night stay requirement nor a minimum time before the customer can return. Fare reductions of up to 20 percent are also being put in place on one-and seven-day advance purchases on flights generally of 600 miles or longer, Valentine said. Southwest is the nation's eighth largest carrier, serving 31 airports in 14 states.
